English: Excuse me, madam. Could you tell me where the post office is?
Mandarin: 对不起，女士，请问邮局在哪里？

English: It's just around the corner.
Excuse me, how can I get to the bus station?
You can take the bus and get off at the second stop.
Mandarin: 你可以坐公共汽车第二站下。

English: Excuse me. Where is No.5 Street?
Mandarin: 对不起，第五大街在哪儿？

English: Go straight ahead and turn left at the second crossing.
Mandarin: 对不起，你能告诉我怎么去胡先生的餐馆吗？

English: Excuse me. Can you tell me how to get to Mr. Hu's restaurant?
Mandarin: 对不起，你能告诉我怎么去胡先生的餐馆吗？

English: Go on for about 100 meters. It's on your left side. You can't miss it.
Mandarin: 往前走约1米，在你左手边，你不会错过的。

English: Which one is Mr. Jame's office?
Mandarin: 哪间是詹姆司先生的办公室？

English: It's Room 201 on the second floor.
Can I use the elevator?
Sorry, it's broken. You have to use the stairs.
Mandarin: 对不起，它坏了，你只能走楼梯了。

English: Where are the stairs?
Go along the corridor and it's on your right side.
Mandarin: 沿着走廊走，在你右手边。

English: Thank you for directions.
Would you please open the door for me?
May I ask you a question?
Please give me a hand.
Could you do me a favor?
Would you help me remove the refrigerator?
Get me my coat, please.
Make me a cup of coffee, will you?
Call me tomorrow if you have time.
Mandarin: 明天要有时间就给我打个电话。

English: Could you tell me where I can find these books?
Mandarin: 您能告诉我在哪儿能找到这些书吗？

English: Certainly.
Witch pleasure.
I'm sorry. I'm engaged now.
I'm glad to, but I'm afraid I don't have the time.
Mandarin: 我很乐意，但我恐怕没时间。

English: Would you mind closing the window for me?
Mandarin: 能帮我关一下窗户吗？（你介意关下窗户吗？）

English: Not at all.
What's the height of the building?
How much does the elephant weight?
What's the color of your new dress?
Mandarin: 你的新衣服是什么颜色的？

English: What's the size of your shoes?
My brother is twice as tall as your sister.
Mandarin: 我弟弟比你妹妹高一倍。

English: My grandma is 40 years older than me.
This river is one third as long as that river.
Mandarin: 这条河只有那条河的三分之一长。

English: What's the shape of your balloon?
How wide is this bridge?
How thick is the ice here?
This metal is harder than that one.
He can run as fast as Jim.
Kate is smarter than I.
How long do you watch TV every day?
Mandarin: 你每天看多长时间电视？

English: How often do you go swimming?
Where are you going?
Where did you go for dinner yesterday?
Mandarin: 你们昨天去哪儿吃的饭？

English: When will he come to see you?
When did you buy the car?
Who told you?
Who will accompany you to the airport?.
Why don't you agree?
Why not go out for a walk?
How did you doing spend your holiday?
How are you doing these days?
What did he say in the letter?
What are you going to do with the books?
Mandarin: 你打算拿这些书怎么办？

English: What were you doing when I called?
Mandarin: 我打电话给你时你在干吗？

English: I was about to leave.
Can you guess what I was doing this morning?
Mandarin: 你能猜到今天上午我在做什么吗？

English: Hi, Jack, where do you live now?
Mandarin: 你好，杰克，你现在住哪儿？

English: I live at 203 Curzon Street.
Curzon Street? Isn't Mary living there?
Mandarin: 可胜街？玛丽不是也住那儿吗？

English: Yes, she lives just across the street.
How long have you stayed there?
Just a few months.
How about Mary? How long has she lived there?
Mandarin: 玛丽怎么样？她在那儿住多久了？

English: She's been living there since her birth.
Will you stay there for long?
Mandarin: 你会在那儿待很长时间吗？

English: No, I'll move to Hollywood next month.
Mandarin: 不，我下个月搬到好莱坞去。

English: Oh, really? I'm moving there too.
Mandarin: 真的？我也会搬到那儿去。

English: Great. Then we can drink beer together.
Mandarin: 棒极了，我们可以一起喝啤酒了。

English: Yes, and you may stay there longer.
Mandarin: 对，而且你也许会在那儿住久一些。

English: I hope so.
I'm sure we'll have a good time.
Mandarin: 我相信我们会很开心的。

English: I used to take a walk in the early morning.
Mandarin: 我过去常一大早出去散步。

English: He used to live in my neighborhood.
Did you use to go fishing with friends?
Mandarin: 过去你常和朋友钓鱼吗？

English: We have known each other for 6 years.
It has been a long time since last came here.
Mandarin: 自从我上次来这里已经有很长时间了。

English: Have you seen Mr. Smith recently?
Mandarin: 最近你见过史密斯先生吗？

English: They've been working on this project since last year.
Mandarin: 他们从去年开始一直都在做这个项目。

English: I've been watching TV all night.
The movie began as soon as we got there.
Mandarin: 我们一到那儿电影就开始了。

English: When I arrived at the station, the train had already left.
Mandarin: 我到车站时，火车已经开了。

English: The late arrival of the ship had messed up all our plans.
Mandarin: 船到晚了，把我们的计划全打乱了。

English: I had thought he knew the time of the meeting.
Mandarin: 我原以为他知道开会时间。

English: They had excepted me to go with them.
Mandarin: 他们原本希望我和他们一起去。

English: That was the third time that I had visited the place.
Mandarin: 那是我第三次参观那地方了。

English: After I had finished my paper, I put it in the drawer.
Mandarin: 我写完论文，就把它放在抽屉了。

English: Hi, Joe, is it really you?
Hi, Ann. Nice to see you again.
Mandarin: 安，你好。真高兴再次见到你。

English: It's been a whole year since I last saw you.
Yes, but you look as pretty now, as you did then.
Mandarin: 但你看起来还是那么漂亮。

English: Oh, thank you. How have you been these days?
Mandarin: 欧，谢谢。这段时间你好吗？

English: Not too bad.
But you sound so sad.
Yes, I lost my pet cat yesterday.
Mandarin: 是啊，昨天我的宠物猫丢了。

English: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that
That's all right.
Have you seen Kate lately?
No, I have no contact with her.
Mandarin: 没有。我和她没有一点儿联系。

English: I heard she got married last week.
Oh, how nice. Sorry, I've got to go now.
Mandarin: 那真好。对不起，我必须得走了。

English: So do I. See you later. Keep in touch.
Mandarin: 我也是，再见。记得联系哦。

English: When did you get up yesterday morning?
At about seven.
I heard the clock, but I didn't get up until 9.
Mandarin: 我听见闹钟了，但我捱到九点才起。

English: I woke up seven and got up right away.
Mandarin: 我七点醒了，然后马上起床了。

English: I hurried to my office.
I had my breakfast on the way.
I was just on time.
I was 10 minutes late
I had lunch with a friend of mine.
Mandarin: 我和我的一个朋友一块吃了午饭。

English: I finished my work at 6 p.m.
I stayed and did some extra work.
The TV programs were really boring, so I went to bed very early.
Mandarin: 电视节目很无聊，所以我早早睡了。

English: I read a magazine in bed.
I didn't sleep well. .
I slept soundly all night
When do you get up everyday?
I usually get up at 8 o'clock.
Where do you have your lunch?
I have my lunch in a snack bar nearby.
Mandarin: 我在附近一家快餐店吃午饭。

English: What did you have for lunch?
I had a hamburger and a fried chicken leg?
Mandarin: 我吃一个汉堡包，一个炸鸡腿。

English: What time do you start work?
I start work at 8 o'clock.
What do you do at work?
I answer telephones and do some typing.
What time do you finish your work?
At 6 o'clock sharp.
What do you do in your spare time?
I like listening to pop music.
I like playing football.
How old are you?
I'm twenty-two (years old).
Mr. Smith is still in his forties.
Mandarin: 史密斯先生才四十几岁。

English: I'm two years younger than my sister.
My elder sister is one year older than her husband.
He's the youngest in the family.
He looks much younger than he is.
Mandarin: 他看起来比他实际上年轻得多。

English: I came here when I was 20.
I started school at the age of 6.
My father is over 60 years old.
Most of them are less than 30.
I guess he's about 30.
She's going to be 15 next month.
They'll have a party for their 10th wedding anniversary.
Mandarin: 他们将为结婚十周年来个聚会。

English: He's still a boy after all.
What are you doing?
I'm reading a book.
I'm cooking.
Are you watching TV now?
Yes, I'm watching Channel 5.
No, I'm listening to the radio.
Where are you going?
I'm going to work
Who are you writing to?
I'm writing to an old friend.
What will you do this weekend?
I'll go to a concert.
I'll go on an outing with some friends.
Do you like traveling?
Yes, I like it a great deal/it very much.
Do you speak English?
Yes, a little.
How long have you studied English?
He speaks English fluently.
Your English is very good.
You speak English very well.
Are you a native speaker of English?
My native language is Chinese.
He speaks with London accent.
He has a strong accent.
I have some difficulty in expressing myself.
I'm always confused with "s" and "th".
Can you write in English?
Your pronunciation is excellent.
How can I improve my spoken English?
Mandarin: 我该怎样才能提高口语水平？

English: Hello. Can I see Mr. Green?
Mandarin: 你好，我能见格林先生吗？

English: Do you have an appointment?
Sorry, I don't.
Yes. At 3 pm.
Sorry, Mr. Green can't see you now.
Mandarin: 对不起，格林先生现在不能见您。

English: He's on the phone.
Would you wait here for a minute?
Would you like something to drink?
Tea, please
Mr. Green, Mr. Smith is here.
Mandarin: 格林先生，史密斯先生在这里。

English: You may go in now.
Nice to see you, my old friend.
Mandarin: 真高兴见到你，我的老朋友。

English: How have you been these years?
You've changed little.
Do you still remember that Christmas?
Mandarin: 你仍记得那个圣诞节吗？

English: What time is it now?
It's two o'clock.
It's a quarter past five.
It's ten minutes to four.
It's half past nine.
It's one o'clock sharp.
It's not four o'clock.
My watch says two o'clock.
My watch is two minutes fast.
What's the time by your watch?
We must arrive there on time.
There are only two minutes left.
Can you finish your work ahead of time?
The flight is delayed.
The meeting is put off.
Do you have a computer?
Yes, I do.
He has that book, doesn't he?
No, he doesn't.
Do you have any brothers or sisters?
No, I'm a single son.
Could your computer access to internet?
Mandarin: 你的电脑能连到互联网吗?

English: Do you have shampoo here?
What a beautiful garden you have!
Any tickets left?
Do you have glue? I need some here
Mandarin: 你有胶水吗？我这里需要一点。

English: I have some left.
If you have more, please give me some.
Mandarin: 如果你有多的，请给我一些。

English: Do you have my pencil?
Yes, I have your eraser, too.
Mandarin: 是的，我还拿了你的橡皮。

English: What day is it today?
It's Monday today.
What's the date today?
It's January the 15th, 1999.
What month is this?
It's December.
What year is this?
It's the year of 1999.
What will you do during this weekend?
Does the shop open at 9 am on weekdays?
Mandarin: 这家店平日是早上9点开门吗？

English: It opens at 8 am on weekdays, but at 9 at weekends.
Mandarin: 平日上午8点开，但周末9点开。

English: What will you do the day after on next?
What did you do the week before last?
I'll work for the next 5 days.
Mandarin: 我要工作5天（从明天算起）

English: It's been 5 years since I last saw you.
What's your name?
May I have your name?
My name is Thomas.
Just call me Tom.
What's your family name?
My family name is Ayneswonth.
How do you spell it?
Who is the lady in white?
Mandarin: 穿白衣服的那位小姐是谁？

English: Could you introduce me to her?
Rose, let me introduce my friend to you.
Mandarin: 罗斯，让我介绍一下我的朋友。

English: This is Tom. He's my classmate.
Nice to meet you.
Nice to meet you, too.
Let me introduce myself.
How do you do?
Who are you?
I'm Jim.
Who is the guy over there?
He's Bob.
Is that girl a student?
No, she isn't.
What do you do?
I'm a farmer.
What is his job?
He's a manager.
She must be a model, isn't?
Mandarin: 她一定是个模特，不是吗？

English: I really don't known.
I have no idea about it.
Can she be a driver?
Yes, I think so.
I found a backpack.
Whose watch is this?
Is this yours?
Yes, it's mine.
Where are my glasses?
Do you know where I've put my glasses? .
Mandarin: 你知道我把眼镜搁哪儿了吗？

English: Over there.
On the desk.
Is this your pen? I found it under the desk.
Mandarin: 这是你的笔吗？我在桌下捡的。

English: No. Mine is blue.
Which one is your bag?
The bigger one.
The one on your right.
Are these books all yours?
Some of them are mine.
What's this?
It's a pen.
Is this your handbag?
No, it isn't. / Yes, it is.
Whose jacket is this?
It's Kate's.
Is that a car?
No, it isn't. It's a bus.
What do you call this in English?
What is the color of your new book?
Mandarin: 你的新书是什么颜色的？

English: How big is your house?
What's the problem?
What's the name of the cat?
Where's the company?
Which is the right size?
May I come in?
Come in, please.
Sit down, please.
It's time for class.
Open your books and turn to page 20.
I'll call the roll before class
Here!
Has everybody got the handout?
Mandarin: 每个人都拿到材料了吗？

English: Any different opinion?
Have I made myself clear?
Are you with me?
Could you say it again?
Any questions? .
That's all for today.
Please turn in your homework before leaving.
Mandarin: 请在离开前将作业交上。

English: Hello/Hi!
Good morning / afternoon / evening!
I'm John Smith.
Are you Peter King?
Yes, I am. / No, I'm not.
How are you?
Fine, thanks. And you?
I'm fine, too.
How is Amy / your wife / your husband?
Mandarin: 爱米好吗？/你妻子好吗？/你丈夫好吗?

English: She is very well, thank you.
Good night, Jane.
Good-bye, Mike.
See you tomorrow.
See you later.
I have to go now.
What do you think about it?
Is that right?
Absolutely right.
I think you're mistaken about that.
Is that ok?
That's ok/fine.
That's excellent.
He was absent yesterday. Do you know why?
Mandarin: 昨天他没到，你知道为什么吗？

English: Do you have any idea?
I suppose he was sick.
Will it rain tomorrow?
No, I don't think so.
Do you really want to know what I think?
Mandarin: 你真想知道我怎么想吗？

English: Please give me your advice.
I want to hear your opinion.
I get up at 8 every morning.
I then take a bath in the bathroom.
Mandarin: 然后我去洗澡间洗个澡。

English: I shave, brush my teeth, and comb my hair
I put on a bit of makeup.
I cooked breakfast for the family.
I go downstairs and have my breakfast.
I read the newspaper over breakfast
I wake my sister up.
I dress my sister and wash her hands and face.
Mandarin: 我给我妹妹穿衣服，洗脸洗手。

English: I get to my office at 10:30.
I leave the office at 7.
I go shopping every weekend.
I buy some food on my way home.
I pick up my sister from her school.
We go to bed at 10:30.
How are you feeling today?
I don't feel very well.
Do you fell better now?
Much better.
I'm sick.
He's got a bad headache.
My fever is gone.
What's the matter with you?
I've got a pain in my back.
It really hurts.
It hurts right here.
It's bleeding. You'd better see a doctor about that cut.
Mandarin: 在流血呢，你最好找个医生看看这伤口。

English: Call the doctor!
Take two pills and have a good rest.
Mandarin: 吃两片药，好好休息一下。

English: I hope you'll be well soon.
Have you heard the weather forecast?
No, what does it say?
We'll have fine weather for the next few days?
But it's still raining today!
It is said it will clear up tonight.
Mandarin: 天气预报说今晚雨就会停。

English: What will it be after the clear weather?
Mandarin: 晴天以后天气会怎么样？

English: It says a storm may come next month.
Mandarin: 天气预报说下个月会有一场暴风雨。

English: And it may get colder, it's already November.
Yes, and I hope we can have some snow this winter.
Mandarin: 是的，我希望今年冬天会下雪。

English: I'm afraid it won't be cold enough for a snowfall.
Mandarin: 我恐怕天不会冷的下雪。

English: But last year we had a big one.
Yes, but you know global warming may raise the temperature.
Mandarin: 是的，但全球变暖会使气温上升。

English: You are probably right.
I'm going skating in the Alps next month.
Mandarin: 下个月我去阿尔卑斯山滑雪。

English: I hope the weather there is cold enough.
What time are you going to leave for the airport tomorrow?
Mandarin: 你明天打算什么时候去机场？

English: Is he coming to dinner?
I'm going to the bookstore. Will you go with me?
Mandarin: 我要去书店，你和我去吗？

English: They're going to discuss it at the meeting next Friday.
Mandarin: 他们将在下周五的会上讨论这个问题。

English: I'll be waiting for you at the restaurant this time tomorrow.
Mandarin: 我明天这时候在餐馆等你。

English: After I get home, I'll call you.
Mandarin: 到家以后，我会给你打电话。

English: How will you spend the evening?
I'll probably stay home and watch TV.
Mandarin: 我可能会呆在家看电视。

English: What's your plan for the summer holiday?
I'm thinking about a visit to Paris.
There's going to be a pottery exhibition at the art gallery.
Mandarin: 艺术馆将有一次陶瓷展。

English: You are still thinking about a Ph.D., aren't you?
Mandarin: 你还是想学成博士，是吗？

English: What will you do about it?
What do you want to do after graduation?
I'll further my study.
Do you know Mary?
Sure. We are friends since primary school.
Mandarin: 当然，我们从小学就是朋友了。

English: Really? I was introduced to her just last weekend.
Mandarin: 真的？上周末我才被介绍给她。

English: What is she doing now?
She told me she wanted to start a company
Start a company? But I thought she would be a scholar.
Mandarin: 开公司？我原以为她会成为一个学者

English: People are always changing, aren't they?
Yes, you're right. After all, she is smart enough to go into business.
Mandarin: 是啊，你说的对。毕竟，她完全有经商才智。

English: But she doesn't have much experience.
You two don't have much contact？
No, I only wrote her one letter this year.
Mandarin: 是的，今年我才给她写过一封信。

English: And she?
She sent me a Christmas card last year.
Oh, that's not good.
Yes, we should try to contact more.
Mandarin: 是的，我们应该联系多点。

English: Are you married?
I'm single.
Did you hear of that John proposed to Marry?
Mandarin: 你听说约翰向玛丽求婚了吗?

English: They engaged two weeks ago.
She's engaged/married to John.
How long have you been married?
We've been married for 2 years.
My parents got married in 1954.
Mary gave birth to a baby last week.
They've been divorced.
His wife died a year ago. Now he lives alone
Mandarin: 他妻子去年去世了。现在他一个人住。

English: My aunt will come to live with me for some days
Mandarin: 我阿姨会来和我住一些日子。

English: John has his own family now.
Mandarin: 约翰现在有自己的家了。

English: Do you live with your parents?
No. I live in my own house.
Mandarin: 不，我住在自己的房子里。
